sec.p: The experiment was carried out at the Faculty of Science Semlalia in Marrakech (31°37′N–08°02′W, 470 m above sea level). The experimental area is characterized by an arid climate with an average temperature in the warmest month of 38.3°C and of 4.5°C in the coldest one and a mean rainfall of 242 mm/year. The soil characteristics were as follows: sand (37.3%), silt (24.2%), clay (38.5%), pH (8.06), electrical conductivity (0.28 mS/cm), organic matter (2.9%), total N (0.65%), P (7.96 mg/100 g), K (40.58 mg/100 g), and Ca (18.22%).
